00001 #include "BuildDefines.h"

00005 #ifndef __ROAD_SMOOTHING_H
00006 #define __ROAD_SMOOTHING_H
00007 
00008 //There are the 32 macro definitions that make up all of the road pieces.  These enumerations
00009 //match up exactly to the previous road system order of graphics (FIRSTROAD1 - FIRSTROAD32)
00010 enum
00011 {
00012       L1,         //left 1 -- this is a left straight-away edge
00013       R1,         //right 1 
00014       B1,         //bottom 1
00015       T1,         //top 1
00016       TTR,  //top top-right corner piece (the top part of the top-right corner)
00017       BTR,  //bottom top-right corner piece (the bottom part of the top-right corner)
00018       LBL,  //left bottom-left corner piece
00019       RBL,  //right bottom-left corner piece
00020       LTL,  //left top-left corner piece
00021       RTL,  //right top-left corner piece
00022       RBR,  //right bottom-right corner piece
00023       LBR,  //left bottom-right corner piece
00024       L2,         //left 2  (variation of the left 1)
00025       R2,         //right 2
00026       L3,         //left 3
00027       R3,         //right 3
00028       B2,         //bottom 2
00029       T2,         //top 2
00030       B3,         //bottom 3
00031       T3,         //top 3
00032       BI,         //bottom intersection (piece connecting bottom to right)
00033       LI,         //left intersection           (piece connecting left to bottom )
00034       TI,         //top intersection            (piece connecting top to left)
00035       RI,         //right intersection  (piece connection right to top)
00036       L4,         //left 4
00037       R4,         //right 4
00038       B4,         //bottom 4
00039       T4,         //top 4
00040       RE,         //right edge (end of road)
00041       LE,         //left edge
00042       BE,         //bottom edge
00043       TE,         //top edge
00044       NUM_ROAD_MACROS   
00045 };
00046 
00047 //The old road system used multi-tiled roads as a single image.  The new road system has taken these large
00048 //pieces and chopped them up into single tiled images (to mitigate lighting problems).  Some of the larger 
00049 //road pieces turned into 18 smaller pieces.  So this function will go analyse the world, and replaces any 
00050 //locations containing the original road tile information, delete it, and replace it by inserting it's 
00051 //equivalent macro.
00052 void ReplaceObsoleteRoads();
00053 
00054 //Road macros vary in size from 3 gridnos to 18 gridnos.  Using the anchor gridno based off of the original
00055 //road system, this function will place the new macro (consisting of multiple road pieces in multiple
00056 //gridnos).
00057 void PlaceRoadMacroAtGridNo( INT32 iMapIndex, INT32 iMacroID );
00058 
00059 void InitializeRoadMacros();
00060 
00061 
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 #endif
